page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN SHROTON
page.content: SHROTON STILL PROVIDES EMPLOYMENT FOR A FEW PEOPLE. MOST OF THE FARMERS NOW OWN THEIR LAND AND THEY HAVE TO BE VERY WELL ORGANISED BUSINESS MEN TO CONTROL A LARGE ACREAGE WITH ONLY A FEW WORKERS. THEY USE COMPUTERS TO PLAN SUCH THINGS AS FEEDING PROGRAMMES FOR THEIR COWS AND THE FORWARD PLANNING OF THEIR CROPS IN EACH FIELD. A SMALL NUMBER OF THE INHABITANTS ARE FARM MANAGERS AND SECRETARIES. THERE IS ALSO A HERDSMAN AND SOME AGRICULTURE WORKERS. THERE ARE WARDENS WHO SUPERVISE THE BUNGALOWS FOR THE ELDERLY AND THE FLATS IN THE RECTORY. ONE WOMAN RUNS A GUEST HOUSE AND THERE IS A SELF-EMPLOYED BUILDER. A FEW DOMESTIC JOBS STILL EXIST - THERE IS A COOK FOR RANSTON HOUSE WHO HAS HER COTTAGE PROVIDED. THERE ARE ALSO SOME GARDENERS. THERE IS LITTLE UNEMPLOYMENT.
